page.title: 13A SOUTH HAMS FARMER'S YEAR
page.content: {April}:The cattle go out to pasture. Dairy herd are tended. {May}:The cattle's winter pens are thoroughly cleaned out.Dairy herd.The first silage crop is harvested,and the crops are sprayed with insecticide. {June}:Dairy herd.Sheep shearing.Wild oats are picked out of the corn. {July}:Dairy herd.The sheep are dipped. Spring barley and other crops are harvested using a Combine Harvester. Second cut of silage is made. {August}:Dairy herd.The harvesting is completed.At the end of the month, calving begins. {September}:Dairy herd.Calves are born at a rate of 20 to 30 per day.They are seperated from their mothers after 1 day and are then finger fed.By 8 weeks they can be fed by automatic dispenser and then on to dry food. Continued page 14.
